Everything is tempered, except the line "ooze a molten victory." Untempered chocolate is considered unfit for fanfare or decoration in the chocolate world. Much like war, victory isn't quite victorious. https://t.co/oRu0MeTvoY

The type style shifts from ordered and smooth to aggressive and chaotic. This mirrors the disruption of war to everyday life. 

The bottom lines attempt to return to normalcy, a paradox. Life continues while never the same. https://t.co/7MtgyNKdpT

On the day of the invasion I wrote a poem comparing chocolate and war bc #IStandWithUkraine. And I knew food type could add an extra layer to this story.

Tempered chocolate is a delicate balance. It snaps cleanly, stretches to hold its shape, much like peace between nations. https://t.co/23bLftRzR4

Help me out #web3! I am auctioning my first piece @KnownOrigin_io, a war poem made entirely of chocolate, for Ukrainian refugees.

Opens at .08 $ETH 
Starts at 6:20pm EST 
50% goes to @Ukraine_DAO or Black Ukrainian refugee gofundme's.

Community building fascinates me, as many of these conditions are agreed upon subconsciously. As web3 and world events unfold in tandem, we are asked to define how we unite and what tears us apart.

Iâ€™ve been guilty of saying â€œwhy does this need a law? Why canâ€™t we teach people to be decent?â€ in the past. But laws allow for min. protections. 

I enjoy shaping culture organically because I unite with others over shared values. And yet we need codes of conduct.

Of course there are always counter movements, like the introduction of US human rights bills because the culture keeps failing protected classes. 

Or in a place like web3, if you donâ€™t grasp the vibe but have cash, you can form a board.

Generally, progressives change the future via culture, where conservatives use legislation.

I see this irrespective of political alignment. If you have no cultural foothold, youâ€™ll form a committee. If you have no political sway, youâ€™ll take to the streets.
